summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2005 VICTORY KINGPIN. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: 06V258000 (POWER TRAIN) AND TOOK THE MOTORCYCLE TO THE DEALER FOR THE COMPLETION OF RECALL REPAIRS.  THE FOLLOWING DAY, SHIFTER WELD LINKAGE FAILED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE AND THE SHIFTER WELD LINKAGE WAS REPLACED.  THE FAILURE AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 14,000.   UPDATED 05/29/14 MA  THE CONSUMER HAD A PROFESSIONAL BIKE BUILDER RE-WELD THE LINKAGE. UPDATED 08/05/14

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2005 POLARIS VICTORY KINGPIN MOTORCYCLE.  WHILE DRIVING 2-20 MPH, THE CONTACT HEARD A RUBBING SOUND COMING FROM THE FRONT AND REAR BRAKES.  THE FRONT END OF THE VEHICLE BEGAN TO VIBRATE.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT WITHIN 3,000 MILES, THE FRONT BRAKE PADS BECAME WORN AND HE FELT THAT THE ROTORS CAUSED THE FAILURE.  THE DEALER WAS UNABLE TO DIAGNOSE THE CAUSE OF THE FAILURE.  THE POWERTRAIN WAS UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 500 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 4,000.  UPDATED 12/12/07 * BF  UPDATED 12/12/07  *TR

REFUSAL BY DEALER TO CORRECT SAFETY RECALL ON POLARIS, VICTORY, KINGPIN MOTORCYCLE.  VICTORY SAFETY RECALL NOTICE 06V-258.  WARNING AND SAFETY RECALL BULLETIN V-06-04.  REASON:  A WELD ON THE SHIFT LEVER SHAFT ON SOME 2004 & 2005 VICTORY MODELS MAY NOT MEET VICTORY QUALITY STANDARDS AND MAY FAIL DURING OPERATION.  IF THE WELD FAILS THE OPERATOR CANNOT SHIFT GEARS INCREASING THE RISK OF A CRASH.  POLARIS INDUSTRIES DOES NOT ANSWER E-MAIL OR LETTERS.  PRESCOTT VALLEY MOTORCYCLES DOES NOT ANSWER E-MAILS.  *NM
